summary: This bill, the Richard L. Trumka Protecting the Right to Organize Act of 2025, significantly amends the National Labor Relations Act, the Labor Management Relations Act of 1947, and the Labor-Management Reporting and Disclosure Act of 1959.  It aims to strengthen worker protections, expand collective bargaining rights, redefine employment classifications, and increase penalties for unfair labor practices. The bill also addresses topics such as strike limitations, fair share agreements, and election procedures.
